text: syndrome 90% Short hallux 90% Short stature 90% Cone-shaped epiphysis 50% Abnormality of the metacarpal bones 7.5% Abnormality of the ulna 7.5% Clinodactyly of the 5th finger 7.5% Scoliosis 7.5% Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hand 7.5% Talipes 7.5% Absent distal interphalangeal creases - Autosomal dominant inheritance - Broad metacarpal epiphyses - Broad palm - Distal symphalangism (hands) - Flattened metatarsal heads - Heterogeneous - Proportionate shortening of all digits - Radia
